comments.commentBody: Trump wants to be the King and tries to manage the US Government like he manages his Trump enterprises; with authoritarian style with few unimpactful advisers.  It costs him nothing if he blows the US economy, trade partner relationships or blows trillion dollars to unnecessary stimulation.  The tax payors will carry the burden.  This is a cluster fudge where the majority of voters do not support Trump.  How to stop him is to ensure that Democrats have the majority.  We can't do much about his shot-gun executive orders.
Oh, those tax and spend Republicans!

I'm sorry, but I'm a bit confused. How can it be said that a tariff on imports is paid by the exporter? As I understand the model, the exporter in another country enters into a contract to sell goods to the importer in the U.S. The price of the goods is at the factory door. Shipping and customs clearance are the responsibility of the importer. The customs agent looks at the goods and the documentation and determines the price is X and the duty is 20%, payable by the importer. The importer then the price of the goods in the domestic market at cost of the goods (X) + duty (0.2X) + shipping + local costs + profit.

Everything beyond X is the responsibility of the importer, not the exporter. So how does the duty come out of the exporter's pocket?
And other countries are just going to sit around and not retaliate? You might have a look at how the great depression began.

Mr T's claim is "Mexico will pay for the wall" and he has proposed a tariff/duty on imports from Mexico to generate the funds requried to build the wall. What I want to know is how do tariffs generate MEXICAN funds for the construction?

Yes, I agree tariffs discourage imports and encourage domestic production but that is not the issue here. The question is how do tariffs cause Mexico to remit funds to the US government?
It doesn't, you are correct.  There will not be a 20% tariff imposed on all Mexican goods entering the US.

Something scares me about this logic: imposing tariffs so no one wants to buy products from Mexico, thereby hurting Mexico's economy, and what if that strong armed Mexico into paying for... a wall?

It feels outlandish, but then again that Aetna-Obamacare thing actually happened.
Note also that if cheaper goods are imported from somewhere else  they will not be subject to the 20% tariff, and thus will not raise the funding the tariff was intended to raise.

"Dont they see the Emperor has no clothes?"

Of course they do, and they will never admit it, because it will show them to be spineless sycophants that we all know they are.
A waste of good taxpayer money, and with fewer jobs in Mexico as a result, more people will want to come over/under/around the wall.

“Unless Mexico is going to treat the United States fairly, with respect, such a meeting would be fruitless, and I want to go a different route. We have no choice."

Tough guy. Let's see him say that to Putin.
This guy is going to send the US economy into a tail spin! Not feeling good about my investments or the future. And I am not alone. He is frightening. The worst President imaginable.

You know, I love the NYT's readers- such analytic and educated good folk. But let's face it, to analyze Trump's plans, tweets, orations, tantrums, fantasies and delusions is tantamount to trying to construct rational thought from a schizophrenic- it can't be done. This is also why we don't try people suffering from said disease in a court of law- it is not only unfair to the diseased- it's unfair to the victims.

And yet we (them) made this man president of the United States of America.
So, American consumers have to pay for this wall. Do Trump supporters agree that they should pay a 20% tax on such goods from Mexico like food?

The wall is a terrific idea! It doesn't matter who pays for it. When the depression hits and desperate Mexicans try to return home, we'll stop them at the border and force them to pick lettuce for fifteen cents an hour as part of their penalty for illegal entry.

Dan Kravitz
There is confusion because we have a confused and mentally ill president. When will the GOP ask this president to resign?

Simple math.  1 year 20% surtax on Mexican imports.  Let them retaliate in kind. $60bn annual trade deficit with Mexico * 20% = $12bn net to the U.S. = wall paid for.  All of these liberals who hate Trump and said they would leave the U.S. if he was elected seem to love Mexico all of the sudden.  They are free to leave!  Why do liberals love drugs, gangs and crime from Mexico?  Why do they hate the families of children killed by illegal immigrants?

TL, I hate to break the news to you, but the simple math that you speak of is simple ...the 20% will be paid by you because you will be paying 20% more on the goods received from all imports. Other countries will counter with a tax on our goods exported to them. Obviously, since our goods will cost more, foreign consumers will not buy our products. That means people here will lose their jobs and the price of just about everything will be higher. It looks as though the voters who put us in this predicament will be the first to wonder why they lost their jobs, their health care and will pay a lot more for food and clothing.
Why do you ask questions based on false assumptions?

So, if Mexican goods will no longer be competitive because of a 20% price increase to absorb the Trump tariff, then those Mexican goods won't sell in the US, Mexican imports will plummet to nothing under your economic theory, and -- 20% of zero being zero -- the tariff will not generate any money to pay for the wall. Brilliant.

So you're saying that Mexico will just lower all their prices by 20 percent to offset the tax so we don't buy even more from the Chinese? I doubt it- they'll export as much as they can elsewhere and retaliate with tariffs of their own.  We do, actually sell them goods too.  This is a lose-lose scenario which is impressive, especially if you think of it as a zero sum game.

Unlike most presidents of the past, Trump is keeping the pot stirred, so his opponents, like Mexico, don't know what's coming next. Keep them on their toes. Mexico has taken advantage of the USA for too long. Its time America stood up to Mexico. Put Mexico in its place. Thank you.
Ok, how has Mexico taken advantage of the US...in three...two...one....?
Mexico has taken advantage of us poor Americans?   That's news to me.
"Mexico has taken advantage of the USA for too long ????? It's too bad you don't understand how absurd that statement is. See and people like this are allowed to vote

They voted for this man but they also forgot that we are in it together. Don't understand how we got so mad at Obama then decided to appoint a person that don't have experience and humility to occupy such position. More like hiring a carpenter for a dentist job, yeah they both remove stuffs. While a dentist removes your teeth a carpenter also removes nails. Heheheheheh
And just wait until Mexico ends the importation of all of that cheap corn grown in the Midwestern states. The howling will be long and loud.
And don't forget that Mexico could also impose a 20% tax on US imports to Mexico.  That street runs both way.
I'm betting it'll be 30%.

There you go Frank. Sooner or later the Republicans will have to choose. And this country hangs in the balance. He's ill, his narcissistic personality disorder is at the extreme end of the spectrum, and at 70, it's leaking out all over the place. This will only get worse. Each day must become 24hrs closer to impeachment. He's gotta go, let's not wait till it's him or us. Call or write your congressperson now.

As for Mr. Trump's great wall: Ladders, ropes, drills, etc etc. And, of course, shovels: 10 feet down, 10 feet across and 10 feet up again. Mexico is not a prison, it is a large country with  tools -climbing or otherwise - available everywhere at wholesale prices.

IMPULSIVE: acting or done without forethought.
synonyms: impetuous, hasty, emotional,

Trump is preparing to start a trade war over a wall that reasonable people do not believe in. A wall that will change nothing about illegal immigration. A wall that antagonizes our closest southern neighbor unnecessarily. Nobody has proven that illegal immigration is a drag on our economy ever. Immigration is how we grew to be such a powerhouse. Trump's and many others problem is the diversity created by the Hart-Cellar immigration Act of 1965 that allowed many non-white people to immigrate legally to the US. Indians and Chinese for example. Couple that with Hispanic illegal immigration and suddenly lily white America is no more. That is the problem here and, in Britain. Immigration is our power and growth combined at a time when population densities in Europe, Russia and Japan are falling. Immigration keeps us on top.

There's good faith negotiation with the desire to maintain a positive long-term relationship, then there's extortion and not caring who you alienate. Clearly, Trump prefers the latter. That might work with a small contractor you want to screw out of what you owe them, but it's a losing strategy when it comes to international relations. It won't be long before Trump will make the US the pariah of the world.

They are Mexicans thats why.

Racism begins by abandoning logic and facts and the looks for excuses to justify its hateful actions.
